documents.document: The Prime Minister confirms the election date will be announced later today
What on earth is with Wellington's weather. Yet again, I thought the wind was going to lift my house up overnight, wizard of oz style.
Fig farmers capitalising on Hawke's Bay's drought https://t.co/Ynz7VRnPs1
At HN water inquiry, Hastings DC water services manager Brett Chapman reveals there was campylobacter found in the Brookvale bores on Jan 19
@Johnmck419 you cover politics, I'll do the sports? I think staying here in the hot sun for the ODI is a good idea https://t.co/3RTbQVkeci
@Johnmck419 I'm really good at sports pickups.
Tfw the Aussie cricket team rock up to your hotel with a truck full of gear. @Johnmck419 do you need a sports pickuâ€¦ https://t.co/0ul7pTCTpf

@jmodoh @rarahsobson @CTrevettNZH but junior j j j you look like you're laughing. You're secretly one of us now, right?
So wrong. We all know it's a potato fritter. https://t.co/LaudO2Fq3r
Hastings DC has had more "transgressions" with its water supply than any other area, the Havelock North inquiry has heard today @1NewsNZ
Sheep probable cause of gastro outbreak in Havelock North https://t.co/FMRo9GtfMR
@oneforthedr @SparkNZ they said all day yesterday that it was fixed for most people. I had no working phone from 9.45am to 6.30pm.
Little says his Chinese horoscope says he should expect favourable fortune in 2017. Says English's is his luck will decline from Sep.
Andrew Little jokes we've had a terrible summer - and points out the sun finally comes out on a long weekend when Lab/Greens come together
Metiria Turei using her SON speech to pay tribute to women, in particular Helen Kelly & Jeanette Fitzsimons. Urging women to keep fighting.
Comedian Guy Williams introducing the Labour & Greens leaders as leaders of the next Government https://t.co/l7yHyXZTTk
Spark outage has made things slightly difficult at the state of the nation. People scrambling to use hotspots of those who have signal etc
@jo_moir @SamSachdevaNZ You better not take my mantle as the hottest date in town Diva ðŸ˜‚
Guy Williams on stage warming the crowd up ahead of Labour/Greens state of the nation. Standing room only, people oâ€¦ https://t.co/4kB3cfbEWx
@philquin @JoKiwi55 @coltheman1 @pukeko65 agreed. Trolls might need to think about mental health a bit more as well.
@Dovil @CTrevettNZH a little like the gallery party
@JoKiwi55 @coltheman1 @pukeko65 @philquin am I being attacked for doing a story on mental health? So much irony there.
@ToddBarclayMP I count 8 young professionals in Gore!!
Overhaul at Wellington mental health services - but it's just the tip of the iceberg https://t.co/xBeVwjJEcT
@SamSachdevaNZ @jo_moir we all know what telling a girl she looks tired means.
@SamSachdevaNZ it's because you told me I looked terrible cc @jo_moir
@ShayneCurrieNZH I watched this twice and I still can't even believe that it's not a parody. It's worse than awful.
@FrancesCook i just can't imagine what he was possibly thinking in even asking.
@FrancesCook I assume this was more of "you want chips with your burger, right?"
@craigmcculloch I think this is great
@jmodoh @rarahsobson That's what they all say
@rarahsobson @jmodoh I know it's hard to believe JJJ-Junior, but the world doesn't revolve around Australia
@jmodoh All three of you?
@jmodoh Also, blows my mind you actually thought NZers celebrated Australia Day in any way.
@jmodoh What pub?
@pineyzb Now THAT is one of the best ideas I've ever heard.
Peter Dunne has officially launched a petition to get our summer holidays moved to Feb. Says we did it with daylight saving, why not this
@FrancesCook I'm pretty sure this is the first and only time anyone has ever said that.
Spending on pokie machines up, despite number of machines going down - so the Government is demanding answers https://t.co/c1qAeNp1YC
@MyFoodBagNZ @onewilliamsj it's pretty good. And was always close to 3 meals for me. So maybe half a meal for you?
@CTrevettNZH and @alexTarrant is wearing his best dress shorts for HIS first post cab back
No election date today but "fairly shortly" English says, once he's told his caucus colleagues
"Good afternoon and happy new year" - Bill English kicks off his first post-cabinet press conference https://t.co/Oh8PiDcBib
Welcome to the newest member of the press gallery @giaisonline. A few technical difficulties earlier in the day but we'll make her welcome!
@dkinita See my next tweet - typo!
Minimum wage to increase to $15.75 from April 1 (correcting typo in last tweet). The starting out wage will go from $12.20 to $12.60.
@suzikyla23 @kimbakerwilson And that's why we love you.
@suzikyla23 It's called your iphone.
@emmawehipeihana @jo_moir @kelly_armitage1 Jo, ignore those two, they're trouble.
@TaliaShadwell that's what happens when all of Wellington's best cafes are closed ðŸ™„
@jo_moir I'm glad you're home safe then!!
It feels a bit like winter but let's hope it warms up a bit for Wellington Cup Day. Pretty good date too @jo_moir https://t.co/TKbRM9ugJy
@mcquillanatorz Who even are you
My last interview with @ambmarkgilbert before he leaves for the US tonight will be on @1NewsNZ. And one last selfieâ€¦ https://t.co/hnb6jCGDWP
@mcquillanatorz woohoo 30! This seems appropriate considering your eating habits. Have the best 2 day birthday xx https://t.co/rPel1xUIsW
@KevinHague @wimon_song @maggiebarrynz @kimberleysavage wow. Really wish we had known that - and found it.
@KevinHague @wimon_song @maggiebarrynz what IS it though? @kimberleysavage and I walked around trying to find it
@wimon_song got so lost trying to find what the actual circle of friends is the other day. I'm sure there's symbolism in that.
@jo_moir You think the attic is bad. You should try the windowless bunker. The attic is glam compared to this.
@jmodoh regretting making fun of the weather warnings now?
I'm well used to Wellington's wind, but can't say I've ever felt like it was ripping through the inside of my house like it was all night
@Dovil you mean places with more than one vowel?
@kristinhallNZ oh so it was God that nearly killed me, not a drunk driver? Makes sense ðŸ™„
@aehodgkinson trains. Cars. Food. Repeat endlessly.
@rarahsobson @jo_moir maybe that explains things
@jo_moir @rarahsobson wish we could blame the apple shortage for a lack of this https://t.co/ZAGfjgafq9
@jmodoh @rarahsobson @francescook and I were having a lovely lie on the beach this arvo, until we got slammed by flying sand/stones
@aehodgkinson this is what Snapchat is for! I'm always sending outfit choices via snaps
@kelly_armitage1 tbh it's probably a good thing for everyone
@kelly_armitage1 so no more playsuit wearing for me?
@LachlanForsyth got my clean, unworn hoodie in my bag for just this purpose.
@Megapope good, just in time for my arrival. I've barely worn a jersey for 3 weeks, so I'm really looking forward to this ðŸ™„
@kimbakerwilson I KNOW! I'll be back up soon. Or come to Wellington, I hear the weather is spectacular.
Wellingtonians, on a scale of 1 to i-really-really-hate-this, how bad is the weather today for my return?
@jo_moir at least you'll be able to afford a house now
@kelly_armitage1 so proud of him right now ðŸ˜˜
@suzikyla23 thanks so much to you!
@suzikyla23 welcome home!
@pauliolo @emmawehipeihana @kelly_armitage1 if only Emma had any sway over any of the hosts.
@TaliaShadwell is now the right time to tell you i plan to spend the day at the beach?
@Kerry_McBride if I don't check for a couple of hours I come back on & @mcquillanatorz @rarahsobson have so many news updates for me
Hello from the @ASB_Classic. Great day back at the tennis. https://t.co/RyjwLzhkeS
@Johnmck419 My parents reaction upon discovering it was worth the 3 minutes I saw.
@Johnmck419 it's an entire show about making & delivering pizzas. For the sake of your brain cells, please stop watching.
@Johnmck419 I thought this was some "sporting" thing. My parents were channel flicking & have screamed with horror on realising it's real.
@ShakingStick I know I keep ranting but I REALLY REALLY want to know how much time any of these people have spent at Waitangi on the 4/5/6th
@jo_moir was it Ash? ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚
Going through decades of family photos. Found this treasure of myself & my now deceased older brother. Always aboutâ€¦ https://t.co/MbRjjrYg1m
@LachlanForsyth I usually am. Unsure this year. Definitely go if you can!
@Head_Weasel @LachlanForsyth Feb 5 is the day of big (aka more eventful) protests. Feb 6 there's a hikoi but it's peaceful.
@jo_moir @SamSachdevaNZ oh and brunch. But that's usually tied in with either post-gym or post-wine.
@jo_moir @SamSachdevaNZ no more texts for you. We shall communicate about gym and wine via telepathy only
@jo_moir @SamSachdevaNZ but now we get to send the fun texts! You know how 'tis one of my life highlights
@macdee155 @MikeThorpeTVNZ @jo_moir not at all. Read my tweets. I'm saying the 6th at Waitangi is a true celebration of our national day.
@macdee155 @MikeThorpeTVNZ @jo_moir We are talking about the 6th mate. Those things happened on the 5th.
@jo_moir @grantrobertson1 I am very jealous of this.
Yes. Most politicians leave after the dawn ceremony. Perhaps more should stay. https://t.co/xt519u6TCZ
@grantrobertson1 agree. That's my point about the 6th. It enhances prejudices to make it sound like there are problems on the 6th
@grantrobertson1 yes. It's simplifying it but the 5th is for talking (and listening) and the 6th is commemoration & celebration.
